medical_history.chief_complaint: Tobacco dependence in a patient with schizophrenia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. P started smoking cigarettes at age 14 and made at least 20 previous serious attempts to quit, with none lasting more than 3 days. At the time of his treatment, he was smoking 30 cigarettes per day and reported smoking his first cigarette of the day within 5 minutes of awakening and awoke at night to smoke. His exhaled carbon monoxide level was 21 ppm.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mr. P was diagnosed with schizophrenia at age 19, previously had severe psychosis including auditory hallucinations, delusional beliefs, and paranoia. He was treated with clozapine (550 mg/day) for positive symptoms and clomipramine (50 mg/day) for obsessive-compulsive symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: His wife also has schizophrenia, although her symptoms were milder.
medical_history.social_history: Both Mr. P and his wife were unemployed and received disability for their mental illnesses.
